description: This app is very immature and should not be in this store.
I decided to try this to use Proton Drive on Bazzite OS. It works for what I need. Its not perfect, but it already works better than Dropbox which I was looking to ditch anyway. Thank you for this!
The app can't find specific folder and often force close
"This app tried to access sensitive info in your Google Account. To keep your account safe, Google blocked this access."
For an app is not yet at it's first stable release it works perfectly for my use case (with Google drive). Thanks to the developper for this amazing app!
Has been great so far! Works flawlessly, but it'd definetly be nice to have more tweakability.
I used the Nextcloud client before and it worked, but didn't look good. This app helps out also allowing other Cloud providers

I'm using this to sync to Nextcloud, it keeps trying to run over and over again until I stop it even though no changes occur, it wastes a lot of resources and my fans spin loudly whenever I have it running in the background. There's a good chance it's on me but there's not enough feedback from the program to tell me what exactly is going on that's making it behave like this
summary: Can waste resources and doesn't consistently work

description: It'd be nice if support were added for MEGA cloud storage.
Even though I can log into my Pcloud and allow celeste to access my account, it says it's unable to authenticate my account.
Didnt show my google drive content. Then freezed.
Does not show my Google Drive contents
summary: Does not show my Google Drive contents

description:
When I would try to remove all directories it would crash. Sometimes it just crashes when checking and doing its upload things. It also likes to ignore the directories I've set as excluded.

Backtrace I get when the program crashes:

thread 'main' panicked at src/launch.rs:1882:34:
called `Option::unwrap()` on a 'None' value
stack backtrace:
don't install it. it crashes. and isn't reliable. you may lose your data.

Tries to sync way too often (every ~2 seconds), which puts a lot of strain on my server's limited resources. No way to change it too.

This leads to some files having many thousands of versions on Nextcloud. ~100 kb files often can take over 1 gb in real size because of this.

Wanted to exclude a folder from syncing which resulted in it deleting over 3000 of valuable pictures. There was no prompt to confirm deletion or even a warning that it will delete local files. It didn't even check if these files are on the server.

Creating new folders in already synced folders does not sync them. Issue persists both ways.

Often replaces new files with older files from the remote.
Once you have edited the permissions to access your files it simply works and syncs files. Nice
